content.description: Compress between 2 sidepulls to the main ledge, then negotiate your way up to the lip - Another project, grade is an estimate, if you send please let me know what grade you think it is
content.location: Downhill side of the wall, just before the floor drops out

content.description: An easy warmup line with a generous topout ledge
content.location: As far uphill on the wall as possible, around the corner from the tree, last usable line

content.description: Take the name literally. An interesting traverse with some potential until you suddent run out of holds
content.protection: 2-3 pads, gets a lil' too close to the tree
content.location: Uphill side of the wall, right as the very tall section tapers off

content.description: From the low start crimps, powerful deadpoint to the ledge. Traverse right to link up with a line that can take you to the lip. - Was not able to send while I was here, but it feels very hard. Grade is an estimate, if you send let me know what you think it is and I'll update the grade.
content.location: Shown in picture, towards the middle of the wall

content.description: An incredible overhang at Horsethief Lake with something for everyone. Rock is of a varied an inconsistent quality, some is super rough granite/quartz mix, some is shale-ish or limestone. Each line feels a bit different. Although no line is labeled PG-13, some of the lines blur the boundary of highball, so please come prepared with spotters. There are minimal sketchy landings thankfully
